title: Chicken Makhani (Indian Butter Chicken) Recipe
description: This butter chicken recipe, or chicken makhani, is a favorite Indian dish that features a full-flavored sauce with spices that complement chicken.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Curries Chicken Chicken Makhani (Indian Butter Chicken) 4.5 (1,386) 1,006 Reviews 133 Photos This butter chicken recipe, or chicken makhani, is one of my favorite Indian dishes. It features a full-flavored sauce that complements the chicken well. It can be made as mild or spicy as you wish by adjusting the cayenne. Serve with basmati rice and naan bread. Submitted by MITCHMAN21 Updated on February 19, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 133 133 133 133 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Total Time: 35 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 tablespoons peanut oil, divided 1 shallot, finely chopped ¼ white onion, chopped 2 tablespoons butter 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste 2 teaspoons lemon juice 2 teaspoons garam masala, divided 1 teaspoon chili powder 1 teaspoon ground cumin 1 bay leaf 1 cup tomato puree 1 cup half-and-half ¼ cup plain yogurt 1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-size pieces ¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste 1 tablespoon cornstarch ¼ cup water Directions Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Sauté shallot and onion until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in butter, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, 1 teaspoon garam masala, chili powder, cumin, and bay leaf. Cook and stir for 1 minute. Add tomato sauce, and cook for 2 minutes, continuing to frequently stir. Stir in half-and-half and yogurt. Reduce heat to low, and simmer for 10 minutes, frequently stirring. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in a large heavy skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken until lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Reduce heat, and season with remaining 1 teaspoon garam masala and cayenne. Stir in a few spoonfuls of sauce, and simmer until liquid has reduced, and chicken is no longer pink. Add cooked chicken into sauce and stir together. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Dissolve cornstarch into water, then mix into the sauce. Cook for 5 to 10 minutes, or until thickened. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve over rice with naan. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  I Made It Print 1,845 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Chicken Makhani (Indian Butter Chicken) 01 of 133 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 133 Photo by  ModestSauce8534 06/13/2024 Family favorite Easy to follow Great flavors That sounds delicious! Butter chicken is indeed a classic with its rich, flavorful sauce. Adjusting the cayenne gives flexibility to cater to different spice preferences. Enjoying it with basmati rice and naan completes the perfect Indian meal experience! 03 of 133 Photo by  Ruben Chio 08/28/2023 Delicious! 04 of 133 Photo by  ChillyCurd4783 03/28/2022 This recipe is very delicious, even better the following day! I made it last week, and I am making it again tonight. Thank you for a great recipe! For those who think the coriander is missing, it is not, as it is already in the garam masala. I followed the recipe to a 'T' and found the balance to be perfect! Okay, I did cut back on the cream and butter, I used coconut cream due to my dairy allergy, so I would recommend adding both according to your taste. I always make up my garam masala fresh using a recipe online. I used an immersion blender to smooth out and cream my sauce. I also whizzed in some of my cooked rice to get to the desired thickness of my sauce. 05 of 133 Photo by  rozsdad 03/29/2021 Turned out beautifully! No adjustments to the recipe were necessary! 06 of 133 Photo by  lilitiger 12/13/2020 07 of 133 Photo by  Douglas Rammer 11/29/2020 08 of 133 Photo by  Faith Kasanofsky 10/20/2020 09 of 133 Photo by  Lenka 07/04/2020 10 of 133 Photo by  Mary A Shelton 05/17/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Indian-Style "Chettinad" Chicken 1 Rating Wendy's Indian Butter Chicken 76 Ratings Chicken 65 4 Ratings Makhani Chicken (Indian Butter Chicken) 185 Ratings Chicken Chicken Curry 34 Ratings Lasooni Murgh (Garlic Flavored Spicy Chicken) 12 Ratings Authentic Chicken Tikka Masala 272 Ratings Creamy Chicken Korma 275 Ratings Traditional Chicken Curry 34 Ratings Chicken 65 (Quick and Easy Fried Spicy Chicken) 1 Rating Chicken Curry V 16 Ratings Indian Chicken Korma in the Slow Cooker 12 Ratings Spicy Chicken Curry 43 Ratings Hyderabad Dum Biryani 3 Ratings Instant Pot® Chicken Biryani 8 Ratings Indian Tomato Chicken 323 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
